unnormalised: Okay, so I wanted to share my experience with trying to schedule a team meeting last week. You won’t believe the chaos!
normalised: Okay, so I wanted to share my experience with trying to schedule a team meeting last week. You won’t believe the chaos!

unnormalised: It all started innocently enough. I needed to get everyone together to discuss Q3 targets. Simple, right? Wrong. My first hurdle was time zones. We have team members in Mumbai, Bangalore, and a couple working remotely from Guwahati. Trying to find a time that works for everyone is a logistical nightmare. Someone always has to join at some ungodly hour – like 6:30 AM IST or, even worse, 10:00 PM IST!
normalised: It all started innocently enough. I needed to get everyone together to discuss Q three targets. Simple, right? Wrong. My first hurdle was time zones. Someone always has to join at some ungodly hour – like six thirty A-M I-S-T or, even worse, ten P-M I-S-T!

unnormalised: I initially suggested a meeting for 2:00 PM IST on 18/07/2024. Thought I was being clever, smack-dab in the middle of the afternoon. Got a chorus of "Can't make it!" emails back. Turns out Priya has a client presentation at 2:30 PM, and Rakesh has a doctor's appt. scheduled for 14:00 hrs.
normalised: I initially suggested a meeting for two P-M I-S-T on eighteenth july two thousand and twenty four. Thought I was being clever, smack-dab in the middle of the afternoon. Got a chorus of "Can't make it!" emails back. Turns out Priya has a client presentation at two thirty P-M, and Rakesh has a doctor's appointment scheduled for fourteen hundred hours.

unnormalised: Then came the vacation requests! It's July, which means monsoon season and lots of people taking off to escape the humidity. Aisha is going to Kerala from 15/07/2024 to 22/07/2024 and Sanjay's wife has planned a trip to visit family during the week, hence he'll be WFH. Figuring that out, took more time than anticipated.
normalised: Then came the vacation requests! It's July, which means monsoon season and lots of people taking off to escape the humidity. Figuring that out, took more time than anticipated.

unnormalised: After several rounds of Doodle polls and frantic WhatsApp messages, we finally landed on a time: 11:00 AM IST on 20/07/2024. Even then, I had to prepone another urgent task. Let's hope everyone actually shows up because, honestly, I'm exhausted!
normalised: After several rounds of Doodle polls and frantic W-hats A-pp messages, we finally landed on a time: eleven A-M I-S-T on twentieth july two thousand and twenty four. Even then, I had to prepone another urgent task. Let's hope everyone actually shows up because, honestly, I'm exhausted!

unnormalised: The real kicker? After all that, the agenda changed. The Q3 targets aren’t ready yet, so now we're just discussing "team building". Seriously?! I could have just ordered some samosas and chai for everyone at 11:00 instead. Less stress, equally effective.
normalised: The real kicker? After all that, the agenda changed. The Q three targets aren’t ready yet, so now we're just discussing "team building". Seriously?! I could have just ordered some samosas and chai for everyone at eleven instead. Less stress, equally effective.

unnormalised: The moral of the story? Scheduling meetings in India is an extreme sport. Time zones, vacations, and the general unpredictability of life – it all combines to create a perfect storm of calendar conflicts. Next time, I am just going to flip a coin and call it a day!
